Opening: ^It’s been a long time since I’ve been to Caracosa Amusement Park.
^It was too far from home to go on a whim, but too close that it never felt right going when I was away at college.
^But when I received a letter addressed to Roaslind Conner rather than Rory, I knew this was important.
^I could see the lights from the train station. Has the green always reflected off the clouds like that? It looks like vapor.
^The lady behind the counter looked at the letter I gave her. Her eyebrows narrowed.
^I tried to laugh it off. She asked me to buy the ticket and enjoy the last hour before the festivities began. I made my way to The Hollow Castle, where the invitation had instructed us to meet.

^The Hollow Castle had quite the history, once being an old dark ride, then a set piece for a roller coaster, then the queue building for another ride, and now just a walk-through attraction that should have told the story of the Amber Crowned King.
^Instead, it was just a hub for graffiti that no one bothered to clean.
^I wasn’t the first one there, finding the others scattered around the room in small groups. Who should I approach?
ExplorationChapter1: ^The lights overhead flickered, and the dull hum of the music that I had hardly noticed before was gone.
^There was a soft clicking of a speaker, but there was no voice.
^Aburi: “This might be our sign to leave, everyone else did."
^Kate: “She has a point. Well, time to get some exclusive footage?”
^There’s murmuring of agreement as the group split up. The only one who stayed behind was Elias.
^Elias: “No, but I don’t think splitting up is a good idea either. We should travel together.”
artist: ^I made my way over to the artist.
^???: "There's got to be a way to get this off,"
^She seemed to be absentmindedly picking at the paint that covered an old mirror.
^My voice must have startled her as she dropped the papers she was holding. She dropped to her knees faster than I would have expected for someone in heels as she picked up the papers.
^I joined her on the floor, and she sighed.
^???: "It's not your fault, I shouldn't have even brought this here, I just, well I need to practice right?"
^She almost had a laugh in her voice, but the kind of laugh you could tell was forced.
^I looked down at the papers I was holding, it appeared to be a script.
^I looked her over again, perfect makeup and a dress perfectly tailored to her body. Not to mention the golden bracelets pearl neckless. She looked like old Hollywood money.
^I handed it over with a nod, I guess I must have been staring.
^???: "From that reaction, I'd say that you don't recognize me."
^"I don't watch a lot of movies."
^My answer was honest, but it didn't make her any happier.
^???: "You can call me Aubri, thanks for the help Rory but I need to practice."
^With that, she stood up and returned to the mirror.
manWplants: ^I made my way over to the man kneeling next to a plant on the floor.
^???: “It’s quite surprising to see you here.”
^???: “Nature always finds a way to blossom.”
^I let out a small laugh, I guess he wasn't talking to me.
^???: "The real question is, what do I do with you now?"
^I took a step forward, kneeling down on the other side of the plant.
^"Would it be safe to move it outside?"
^The man stumbled back, probably startled, before regaining his composer.
^???: "Yes, but I worry someone will see this guy's not up to snuff with the rest of the garden and kill it anyway."
^"Then I guess we should just try and keep him alive here. I'm Rory by the way."
^I held out my hand, but he didn't take it.
^???: "I'm Warren. Sorry if you heard me talking to this thing, I get a bit...too into my work?"
^"Oh, what do you do for work?"
^I waited in silence for a moment, hoping he would explain what that meant. He didn't.
^I stood back up and backed away.
readingMan: ^I approached the man sitting alone on one of the prop rocks.
^“I think your coat’s got something on it.”
^???: “Are you incapable of taking a hint?”
^???: “Elias. Will you leave me to my book now?”
^Some people are just not meant for social interactions.
girlWcamera: ^I approached the girl with a camera as she tried to find the perfect spot to film.
^???: “But if I stand here the light's all wrong.”
^She seemed to notice me Immediately  as I walked over.
^???: "Hey, can you hold this? I need to film a vlog."
^She didn't exactly give me time to respond before she shoved a video camera in my hand.
^I was thankful that I knew how to use it, tuning the settings before hitting record and giving her a thumbs up.
^She took a breath and her whole demeanor changed, panic becoming bubbly excitement.
^???: "Hey there people, it's Kate, and I am here at Carcosa Amusement Park for their invite-only Halloween event."
^Kate: "So, because I thought it wasn't fair for this to be sooooo exclusive, you all get to tag along with me."
^I wanted to ask her about the invitation, then thought better of it. I really wouldn't want my voice recorded.
^Kate: "I'm going to start by giving you all a tour of the Hallowed Castle. Oh, camara person. I'll take it back now."
^I handed over the camera and quickly ran to be out of frame.
rollerCoaster: ^We walked along the paved road towards the Invesgitation section of the park.
^The Mindbender held the record for the most inversion on a coaster until the Smiler appeared at Alton Towers.
^The black track was hard to see in the dark, but the glowing red eyes of the statue used for a head chopper effect still blazed.
^“Only the most extreme coaster at the park. The queuing area's pretty cool too.”
^Elias: “To think a person would ever go on this is laughable.”
^Elias: “Can’t say I am. Look, just have your fun looking around.”
^“At least walk through the queue with me? I promise it'll be worth it.”
^The queue was designed like an old study, with the line snaking past tall bookshelves.
^I would have sworn they were fake ones, but Elias picked up a leather-bound book and flipped it open.
^“That’s not the important part. Here, read the sign.”
^Elias: “Entering the tavern on a rain-soaked night I found that only one patron sat at the bar. He was dressed in a tattered raincoat and hid his face from me.”
^“Come on, the next one’s up here.”
^Elias: “When I asked him what prompted his drink he laughed and said to me-”
^King: “Any sane man would wish to forget what I had seen.”
^“The story of the ride? This is a theme park after all.”
^Elias: “I could ask you the same thing.”
^“I would tell you if you did.”

^“Fine, the speaker here decided that despite the warning from the sailor he would go to the island and when he gets there his mind is nearly torn apart by the malevolent spirit he calls the jester until a goddess that’s not named spares him but claims his eyes as a price.”

c-0: ^“Come on, scaredy cat. You don’t have to go on the ride if you don’t want to.”
^I raced to the end of the queue, Elias’s footsteps chasing after me.
^I stopped when I saw someone standing behind the control panel.
^As I started to approach, I felt a hand on my arm. Elias spoke in my ear.
^Elias: “This is a bad idea. Let’s just look around for a moment.”
^I nodded and took a moment to take in my surroundings.

mindway: ^It took a long moment for my eyes to adjust to the darkness of the midway.
^The pavement pathway was lined on either side with game tents that looked ominous in the fog.
^“There’s got to be at least one that’s open.”
^Elias: “You used to win prizes for yourself?”
^“I could have said no to traveling with you.”
^I didn’t have an answer for that, so I just focused on all the empty game stalls. It wouldn’t be hard to turn on one of them, would it?
DarkRideExplore: ^Elias and I walked along the dirt paths that lead to the Exploration section of the park.
^I started making my way into the queueing area, following the sloping path.
^I turned around, finding that Elias wasn't following.
^“Look, you can stay up there if you want.”
^“But then you’re going to have to deal with the raccoons all by yourself.”
^“Yeah, the dumpster isn't too far and they love to congregate around there.”
^Elias: “On second thought, let’s enjoy this ride.”
^The queuing area was just as I remembered, the walls painted as false wood and peppered with notices about the mine’s safety.
^The dirt path sloped downward, pulling us farther from the orange glow of the light overhead. I looked to Elias who asked the question I was too uneasy to ask.
^Elias: “You didn’t see the lights on before, did you?”
^“No. Maybe they’re on a motion timer?”
^Elias: “I hope the rest of the ride isn’t.”
^So at the end of the queuing area, we made our way past the carts and traveled along the tracks into the next scene.

^Elias was quick, taking long strides and walking past the scene of the miner’s base camp and the old man with a dead canary. He stopped at the scene of one of the miners overlooking a map as a wide cavern of crystals opened behind him.
DRAnima: ^Walking past the animatronic it sprang to life
^Captain: “It has to be around here somewhere.”
DRMap: ^The map was positioned away from the passing carts, and it was starting to eat at me what it said.
^So I made my way around the scene so I could read it.
^Elias looked a bit dazed as if trying to recall something he had heard before.
DRDoor: ^The doors shouldn’t have been opened. After all, it should be a trigger with the carts crossing a part of the track. I took a few uneasy steps closer, the parting bits of stone decorated with bright yellow chalk. Maybe this ride was also hit with some graffiti.
DRCry: ^The crystals had a soft internal glow, almost like they were LED lights.
^That was proven wrong when Elias slammed the edges of his book into the wall and broke off a small piece of crystal.
^Elias: “I don’t think it’s supposed to do this.”
^He held the crystal to his eye, squinting at the light that seemed to glow brighter before slipping it into his pocket.
^Elias: “I can trust you to keep a secret, yes?”
^His voice sent shivers down my spine. I nodded.
DRKey: ^Near the foot of the animatronic colloquial known as the captain was a key. I picked it up almost without thinking. It wasn’t attached to anything and I slipped it into my camera bag hopefully before Elias had taken notice.
DRFireA: ^Looking out to the track from here I could see a fire alarm I couldn't see before. I looked to Elias who seemed more fascinated with the crystals before walking over and giving it a pull.
^The room was washed in a brilliant orange light and a deep melodic cackle filled the air.
RCAttenent: ^The attendant was dressed in the classic uniform, a dull yellow shirt with a turtleneck underneath it.
^Their eyes were glossy, dazed, as if they’d just woken up from a nap. They also didn’t have a name tag.

^However, it was as I looked down that I realized something was wrong. Their legs were fused into the control panel. Skin melted and fused with wires that snaked up and plunged through their legs like valiant roots in search of food.
RCCam: ^A camera sat in the rafters, the redlight soft but flickering at regular intervals that drew the eye.
RCCandles: ^The LED candles seemed to flicker here more than I remembered. They looked like real candles, even having small plumes of smoke.
RCTapRec: ^Positioned on the track was a tape recorder. I steadily made my way over, keeping to the shadow.
RCBag: ^Inside the coaster car was a backpack. It was likely once a vibrant green and was now caked with dirt and ripped in places.
^I inched my way closer but passed into view of the attendant.
^Attendant: “Take your seats, the ride will soon depart.”
^I snatched the bag and returned to the shadows, thankfully the eyes of the attendant not following.
CoasterSplit: ^The attendant turned to us, speaking almost robotically.
^Attendant: “Please take your seats. We don’t have much time. The goddess demands payment. Your blood will do nicely.”
^I turned to Elias. He shook his head. Who should I trust?

c-0: ^I nodded to Elias and we made our way outside.

RideCoaster: ^I shook my head and made my way to the cart, taking a seat in the front, and lowering the lap bar til it clicked.
^A laugh played over the speaker, the laugh of a Jester.
^Jester: “I would tell you to hold on tight, but you’ve never been good at following directions.”
^The coaster launched and I gripped the lap bar as I was plunged onto the fastest ride of this coaster I’d ever had.
^The turns were sharp, slamming me into the side of the cart.
^Has this coaster always had so many left turns?
^It approached Irius, her sword drawn, prepared for the train to pass between it and her other arm.
^With the glow of her eyes the only light, I thought I saw her fingers twitch.
^I lowered my head and closed my eyes, being met with a loud crunch of metal before the cart plunged into the down of a hill faster than I remember.
^I turned around and found the back half of the train stuck on the other side of the track, Irius’s head had turned to face me with her amber eyes.
^The cart pulled into the unloading area and I tried to pull up on the lap bar, finding it stuck.
^I kept pulling, squirming as it seemed to only get tighter around me.
^The cart moved again, now in the loading area. Elias was reaching for the controls as the glassy-eyed attendant was tugging on his free arm.
^Elias hit a button and the lap bar was unlatched.
^I made a jump for the platform, just making it as the train plunged into the corset again.
^The attendant turned placid, not even blinking as his arms dropped and allowed Elias to pull away.
waterGun: ^I approached a water gun game, letting out a laugh when I saw the collection of bat plushies that hung upside down from chains that were used to draw in commoners.
^“You know how to turn it on?”
^He climbed over the counter and to the spot where the operator would stand. He cleared his throat and spoke with his best carny impression.
^Elias: “Step right up. Step up. Best prizes on the lot here. You- come sit.”
^I couldn’t help but laugh as I took a seat, lining up the water gun. The lights and music flared to life.
^The bell sounded and the water started, it was a perfect bullseye, the water pressing the plate into the trigger that lifted a small dragon statue to the top of the tent.
^The bell sounded again and the lights flashed telling me that I had won.
^I laughed and pointed to one of the bats.
^Elias got it down and unceremoniously threw it to me before turning the game off.
^He was back to his stuck-up tone, rolling his eyes. A thought crossed my mind. Maybe I should give him the bat.
shottingGallery: ^My attention was drawn to a reskinned shooting gallery, but rather than fake guns, they looked like crossbows.
^“You know, I’m good at these games.”
^I approached a game, observing the oversized teddy bears that lined the edges of the play area.
^He climbed over the counter and to the spot where the operator would stand. He cleared his throat and spoke with his best carny impression.
^Elias: “Step right up. Step up. Best prizes on the lot here. You- step and choose your weapon.”
^I couldn’t help but laugh as I picked up the crossbow, a few lights turned on so I could see the target.
^Elias: “Three shots. All three hit the star, any prize on the wall. Whenever you’re ready.”
^He stepped to the side as I held up the crossbow and took in a long breath.
^I closed one eye and adjusted my aim. I fired once. Twice. Three times. All three perfect hits.
^He tossed the bear onto the counter and I took it. It had large golden eyes and a smile that was infectious.
^He was back to his stuck-up tone, rolling his eyes. A thought crossed my mind. Maybe I should give him the bear.
horseRace: ^I approached the horse race game, smiling to myself as I took in the theming. Rather than the horses painted like the horse racing sports, it alternated between knights and rogues.
^I took a seat at one of the rouge’s spots, studying the length of the lane and the size of the holes at the end as Elias turned on the game and set up my lane and another lane for the knights.
^The balls appeared in the basket at the bottom and we both rushed to land the balls into the holes.
^When the lights flashed and the bell sounded I looked to the horses, the knight had won.
^Elias: “Seems you’re not very good at this.”
^“You’re the one who called them kiddy games.”
^He picked up a brown wolf plush and tossed it to me.
^He started walking away, leaving me to chase after him.
giveBat: ^Elias: “Keep it. And maybe try to be less obvious next time you try to flirt.”
keepBat: ^On second thought, it was cute and surprisingly soft for some cheap toy.
giveBear: ^“Hey, this is a bit big for me to hold.”
^Elias: “I'm not carrying around your damn teddy bear.”
^“What if it was your damn teddy bear?”
^I held the oversized plush out to him and he took it.
^Elias: “Don’t think I’ll be telling people how we got this.”
keepBear: ^Or not. Maybe he would think I was flirting.
murderCh1: ^The speakers crackled to life again, this time a voice coming through. It sounded like some of the voice acting used for the rides, but something was still off about it.
^???: “Why don’t you all gather at the Ferris wheel? It seems the night can truly begin.”
^The voice let out a laugh like a hyena, high-pitched and taunting, a sound that made my blood run cold. The look on Elias’s face told me he was feeling the same.
^I led him towards the ferris wheel at the center of the park, finding the others had already gathered.
^Some faces I knew, others I didn't.
^???: “Stay back everyone! I can’t have you interfering with the crime scene.”
^Kate: “You weren’t there! She didn’t fall! Something pushed her!”

c-0: ^Kate: “I mean, it looked like something. Unless wires can come to life. But I guess either way it would be something.
^“I see. Can you describe what it looked like?”
^Kate: “I’m sorry. It was just…big. And it reached into the cart and threw her out.”
c-1: ^“That’s not possible Kate. Maybe you should sit down.”
^Kate: “I know what I saw! It was too big to be a person! People don’t have tentacles!”
^Kate: “If it was someone I would have said someone. I’m not stupid.”
^???: “Seems someone wants to take statements. Fancy yourself an amateur detective?”

c-0: ^“I just want to know what’s going on. After all, we were all called here together.”
c-1: ^“What’s it matter to you? Incapable of acting like a normal person?”
^???: “Well I’m the detective. I will look over the scene first, don’t touch anything. Jess, Stand guard.”
^I looked between the other nine people who were gathered here, then to the scene as the so-called dectecive poked around. I needed to do something. It would be easer to start with the people I knew.

JonPush: ^Jon: “It was swelling, then shrinking, like a vein of reality. It’s not real, right?”

c-0: ^“Of course, it’s not real. You should get some water. Okay?”
c-1: ^“I…I can’t say that it’s not real”

BonnieCh1Intar: ^I approached someone staring at the dead body with a blank and unreadable expression. She was standing unnaturally still and her blinking made me step back. I didn't quite realize she was a real person.
^"Oh, Kate said you got the ride going.”
^Bonnie: “I did, but I didn’t stick around. I went looking for someone who works here. Isn’t it weird that there’s  no one here?”

c-1: ^“I did see someone, at the coaster.”
^Bonnie: “That would have been good to know before. I’m not going to be in trouble right?”

Ch1BH: ^Aubri had a large wound on her head that bled out. I couldn’t see the back of her head from here, but I think the likely cause of the death was the fall Kate talked about.
Ch1BW: ^The bracelets along her right arm had been moved, shifted up to her forearm rather than resting on her wrist. There I saw she had a small tattoo on her wrist. It looked almost like a circle with multiple lines enraged together.

c-0: ^I saw this before. It was on the door to the dark ride. Were the two connected?
c-1: ^It must have been painful to get something so detailed on her wrist.

Tape1: ^In her left hand, Aubri was holding a cassette tape. It was too far away for me to reach, I’d have to ask Hendrix about it if I wanted to listen to it.
Ch1W: ^I tore my eyes away from the scene for a moment, letting them follow a strange backwire that was hanging near her body. I had believed it was attached to the ferrous wheel, but it wasn’t. It didn’t seem attached to anything. Vanishing in the green smoky sky. The more I looked, the more I thought it looked like a tentacle. It also made my head hurt.
Ch1G: ^Her body was sprawled out on the ground, but there was more than just blood, there were flecks of yellow chalk. Did she fall on some street art? I wonder what it was before her fall.
SageCh1Intar: ^I approached someone looking up at the ferrous wheel, hands in the pocket of her paint-splattered apron.
^???: “Those carts don’t look safe at all. Do you think she could have fallen?”

c-0: ^“It’s possible. But this thing’s been in operation for years.”
^???: “Could be old. I just…was she stupid?”
^“I didn’t know her well enough to make that call. I hope not.”
^???: “Maybe we should keep that in mind”
^???" "Weird time for introductions, but I'm Sage"
c-1: ^“I don’t think so. Can actors be stupid?”
^???" "Weird time for introductions, but I'm Sage"
^Sage: “Not really. I was looking for something to eat when I heard the announcement.”

HendrixDoneCh1: ^The detective let out a sigh as she stood up, looking at each of us with a cold suspension that made me want to turn and run.
^???: “She was killed alright. We just need to determine who.”

c-0: ^“Is murder really the most logical option here?”
c-1: ^“I think you should hear Jon’s story. It might prove that-”
^???: “Prove what? That it’s something supernatural? Oh please. Have you seen anything supernatural?”

c-0: ^“I was trapped on the roller coaster. I-I thought I was going to die there. The statue moved, tried to slam her sword onto me.”
^Elias: “I can vouch for her. I saw it too. There’s more going on here than it seems.”
^The detective shook her head, ginger braid swaying with the movement.
^???: “Look, if you all want to spend your time chasing ghosts, be my guest. I’m going to call this in.”
c-1: ^“I guess you have a point, I mean, I haven’t seen anything weird”
^Elias looked at me a bit confused. Did he see something I didn’t?
c-2: ^I was stunned into silence for a moment.
^Elias looked at me a bit confused. Did he see something I didn’t?
c-3: ^“I can see your point, but what if there’s really something?”
^???: “Then be a ghost hunter, just leave me out of this. I have to call this in”

^“Is murder really the most logical option here?”
c-3: ^???: “You think one of us did this?”
^“Is murder really the most logical option here?”

KateCh1Intar: ^Kate whipped tears from her eyes and tried to steady her breathing.
^Kate: “Something grabbed Aburi. Picked her from the basket like picking a berry.”

c-0: ^Kate: “No, I was in the one above her. Bonnie got the ride going.”
c-1: ^“What did it look like? A hand?”
^Kate:  “Well, not a hand, but sharp. Almost like a hook.”

EliasCh1Intar: ^Elias had turned his attention to his book.
^Elias: “Don’t look at me. I was with you the whole time.”
JonCh1Intar: ^I approached someone playing with his scarf, balling it and un-balling it, looking for pockets on his skirt before putting the scarf on and starting the cycle again.
^???: “I…I don’t think I did…I mean…I wasn’t really here I…”

c-0: ^I took a moment and waited for him to calm down.
^???: “I saw this shadow, like a rift cut through the sky, blacker than night. It twisted like lightning. It wrapped itself around the ferris wheel and then…pulsed.”

c-1: ^“It’s all right. You don’t need to say anymore”
^He took a deep breath. “I…I think I was hallucinating. There’s no way what I saw was…there’s no way what I thought I saw was real.”

WarrenCh1Intar: ^Warren was leaning against one of the light posts, eyes darting around the gray metal that lined the stone pathway.
^Warren shook his head. “I was in the gardens, I didn’t see anything. Just heard the message.”
ZeldaCh1Intar: ^I saw someone trying to hide her face in her shirt and turned away from the scene. Her hands were half hidden in her sleeves.

c-0: ^???: “I…I tried to…I tried to... And she…I couldn’t…
^Zelda: “I had her…I had her arm… and she…she was...It was too strong…and..”
^Her voice was shaking, tears brimming in her eyes.
^Zelda: “god. God grabbed her and said..it said that she was a coward. That she could never pass the test. That she…she was our sacrifice.”
^Zelda whipped tears from her eyes and the small bit of blood that fell from her nose.
c-1: ^“Easy. It’s okay. Just take your time”
^“Easy. It’s okay. Just take your time”
^I don’t think it’s a good idea. Maybe Hendrix should talk to her.

InvestMurderCh1: ^When I was done talking to people, I realized if I wanted to know what was going on, I'd need to investigate.
^As Hendrix moved around the scene I tried to get closer, only to feel Jess’s powerful hand holding me back.
^Jess: “Easy now, can’t have you messing up the detective’s work, now can we?”

c-0: ^“Guess I can just wait til she’s done”
^I waited there for a long time.
^"Jess, I don't think she's going to finish anytime soon? What if I just don't touch anything?"
c-1: ^“Are you really thinking this will atone you for being a  thief?”
^Jess: “Look, just, stand here. I don’t think getting closer is a smart idea”

^I turned my attention to the scene before me. Aubri is a tall individual dressed simply for a Hollywood star. Her cherry red heels matched her dress and her black hair was decorated with gold bands. Her blue-gray eyes were open and her face twisted in fear as she lay in the blood that came from a wound on her head.

Default: ^“I know what I've seen. Be it ghosts or something else I’ll be looking into that. It may have been murder, but I know that it wasn’t one of us”
JessCh1Intar: ^I approached the person the detective called Jess, her face was set with determination as she looked over the group of us. Her eyes narrowed slightly as if waiting to jump at someone who broke the rules.
^Jess: “Can’t say I did. I was with Bonnie looking in the gift shop.”

c-0: ^She had a smile that told me not to keep asking.
c-1: ^“You mean stealing from the gift shop?”
^Jess: “Not my fault the place was unlocked.”

CH1edZelda: ^Zelda: “Yeah, I don’t think that’s gonna happen.”

^Jess: “Then maybe we should be listening to the detective?”
^???: “But what if there is something more going on?”
^???: “So what do you say, Rory? You’re my sidekick on this, do you want to chase ghosts or be a real detective?”

c-0: ^“I know what I've seen. Be it ghosts or something else I’ll be looking into that. It may have been murder, but I know that it wasn’t one of us”

c-2: ^“There’s something here. I don’t know what, but I know I won’t rest until I know. Until I can prove what’s going on”

c-0: ^“I know what I've seen. Be it ghosts or something else I’ll be looking into that. It may have been murder, but I know that it wasn’t one of us”
c-1: ^“You have a point. This place is creepy but we can’t be jumping to conclusions. If one of us is a killer, we need to be on alert. As far as we know, we can’t trust anyone.”
c-2: ^“There’s something here. I don’t know what, but I know I won’t rest until I know. Until I can prove what’s going on”
